instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this macbook pro with strange problem, when i start the mac, i hear the dong but without display (nothing with torch), he start on the system when i change the volume sound i hear dong.
i try another display same problem. I close the display wait 1 min after he go in sleep mode, i open the display and i see the desktop and he work well after that.
Do you have any idea about my problem?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message: HIstory??? Water damage??? dropped?? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> when there is no image???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message:
Nothing the computer stop to work normally without nothing (no water, no trace of fall). i verify the motherboard on the other side, no trace of liquid. tomorrow i check the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.
Another information, when i plug a external display, magsafe adapter & keyboard/mouse, i haven't video on external display. or when i have display on screen and i plug external screen, the display don't change mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message: A common failure is bad soldering on <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message: I reflow only <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> or change it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message: Resolder with fine solder tip and some leaded solder.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display at startup
threads.message:
I resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> but no change.
is it <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>?
